step1.sentence: All those late nights studying finally paid off when she got the promotion.

step2.story: Marco spent six months waking up at 5 a.m. to practice his English before work. His colleagues thought he was crazy, but when he landed a deal with an international client, all that effort paid off. He smiled, knowing the sacrifice had been worth every minute.

step3.story: Jina had been pouring her savings into a tiny bakery for two years. There were months when she could barely cover the rent, and her parents kept asking her to find a 'real job.' She ignored the doubt and kept perfecting her recipes, one loaf at a time. Then a popular food blogger stumbled into her shop on a rainy afternoon and posted a glowing review. Within a week, lines stretched around the block. All those sleepless nights and flour-dusted mornings had finally paid off.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 'pay(지불하다) + off(떨어져)'로, 빚이나 비용을 완전히 갚아 없앤다는 뜻입니다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 실제로는 '노력이나 투자가 좋은 결과로 이어지다, 성과를 거두다'라는 의미로 훨씬 많이 씁니다. 오랜 시간 공을 들인 일이 결실을 맺었을 때 사용합니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 원래 빚을 완전히 갚는다(pay off a debt)는 금융 표현에서 출발했으며, '대가를 치른 만큼 보상이 돌아오다'라는 비유적 의미로 확장되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 긍정적이고 보람찬 어감을 지닙니다. 단순히 성공했다는 것이 아니라, 그 이면에 상당한 노력·인내·투자가 있었음을 함축합니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: Years of hard training paid off when she won the gold medal.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 수년간의 힘든 훈련이 그녀가 금메달을 땄을 때 성과를 거뒀다.
